glyP package¶

Submodules¶

glyP.calc_cp module¶

The script is based an extension of the cp.py script published in SI of: Puckering Coordinates of Monocyclic Rings by Triangular Decomposition Anthony D. Hill and Peter J. Reilly

Usage: python cp.py xyz-file or import as module: from cp import cp_values

glyP.calc_cp.cp_values(xyz, ring_atoms)¶

Calculate the puckering angles phi, theta and the canonical shape of the puckered ring

Parameters

  • xyz – the position of each atom

  • ring_atoms – list of the atoms that are present in a ring

Returns

phi, theta and canonical shape

glyP.calc_cp.find_canon(n1, n2)¶

Finds the canonical shape of a puckered ring using 2 angles from the paper by Anthony D. Hill and Peter J. Reilly mentioned in the description of this class

Parameters

  • n1 – (float) phi angle

  • n2 – (float) theta angle

Returns

the canonical shape

glyP.calc_cp.haversine(lon1, lat1, lon2, lat2)¶

Calculates and returns a distance using the haversine formula

Parameters

  • lon1 – (float) the longitude of position 1

  • lat1 – (float) the latitude of position 1

  • lon2 – (float) the longitude of position 2

  • lat2 – (float) the latitude of poition 2

Return distance

(float) distance between two positions

glyP.calc_cp.norm(a)¶

Norm of a vector, basically returns the non-negative value of a number

Parameters

a – (float) some value

Returns

(float) the normalized value

glyP.conf_space module¶

class glyP.conf_space.Space(path, load=True)¶

Bases: list

A conformational space consisting of all conformers found in specified directory. The directory tree should have a structure: ‘molecule’/*/*log if directory ‘molecule’ holds a directory ‘experimental’, an attibute self.expIR is created using the data found there. for different molecules, different lists can (meaning should!) be made.

Generally constructing a conformer space is the first thing to do when using this package. A conformer space will generate a list of conformers.

apply_rotation_matrix(index)¶

Finds and applies the rotation matrix to each conformer being optimally rotated to match a conformer in the list of space with the index provided :param index: (int) the index in the list of conformers that each confromer will be rotated to match

assign_atoms()¶

Labels each atom for each conformer in the space

assign_glycosidic_angles()¶

Calculates the dihedral angles for each conformer in the space

assign_ring_puckers()¶

Identifies each ring of each conformer in the space

calculate_ccs(method='pa', accuracy=1)¶

Calculates the collision cross section for each conformer. The parameters passed should generally just remain as their defaults values

Parameters

  • methond – (string) pa or ehss, methods of calculation

  • accuracy – dont change the default, return a value converged within 1%

create_connectivity_matrix(distXX=1.6, distXH=1.2)¶

Create a connectivity matrix as an attribute to the conf_space: distXX - cutoff distance between heavy atoms distXH - cutoff distance between heavy at - hydrogen

gaussian_broadening(broaden=3)¶

Performs gaussian broadening for the set

load_dir(path, topol=None)¶

Loads a directory with data files to be processed. The path is just the name of the directory, the function will handle the presence of multiple directories within it.

Parameters

path – (string) this is the path to the directory with all the conformer data. This directory should be filled with other directories with the intended name of the conformer and it’s .xyz and input.log files

load_exp(path, ir_resolution=1.0)¶

Selects the experimental conformer that other conformers will be compared to. Creates/updates the self.expIR member of this class

Parameters

  • path – (string) the path to a specific exp.dat file, the path should not just go to the general dir but also include the filename

  • ir_resolution – (float) Resolution of the plot. The value is used to make a grid and the ir_resolution is the number of values skipped between each plotted point. Ex: assuming exp is an array size 10 exp = [1…10], and ir_resolution is 3 the values plotted will be [1,4,7]

load_models(path)¶

Loads a set of specific models used of analysis

plot_ccs(energy_function='E', ccs_exp=141, xmin=130.0, xmax=150.0, ymin=- 1.0, ymax=30.0, xlabel='CCS$^{PA}$ [$\\AA{}^2$]')¶

Coformational free energy vs ccs, for every conformer

print_relative(alive=None)¶

Prints relative energies of each conformer, related to reference_to_zero

reference_to_zero(energy_function='E')¶

Finds a conformer with the lowest specified energy function and references remaining conformers to this.

Parameters

energy_function – (char) either E, F or H. The table will be sorted least to greatest in terms of the energy indicated by this parameter.

remove_duplicates(rmsd=0.1)¶

Removes duplicate conformers from the space

set_theory(**kwargs)¶

Parameters for simulations

sort_energy(energy_function='E')¶

Sorted the conformers according to selected energy_function

glyP.conformer module¶

class glyP.conformer.Conformer(topol, output_path)¶

Bases: object

A class that creates an instance of a molecule defined as conformer. It parses gaussian output file (optimization + freq at this moment to set proper flags, to be fixed for only freq calcs) and creates an object

assign_atoms()¶

Labels each atom in the graph with its atomic symbol

calculate_ccs(temp_dir, method='pa', accuracy=1)¶

Calls program sigma to calculate collision cross section, the sigma must be in the PATH variable. Need to change hardcoded paths otherwise it won’t work

Parameters

  • temp_dir – (string) name of a directory that will be generated to hold onto some files generated during the calculations

  • methond – (string) pa or ehss, different methods of calculation

  • accuracy – dont change the default, return a value converged within 1%

connectivity_matrix(distXX, distXH)¶

Creates a connectivity matrix of the molecule. A connectivity matrix holds the information of which atoms are bonded and to what.

Parameters

  • distXX – The max distance between two atoms (not hydrogen) to be considered a bond

  • distXH – The max distance between any atom and a hydrogen atom to be considered a bond

create_input(theory, output)¶

Creates the parameters to run simulation in Gaussian

Parameters

  • theory – (dict) a dictionary with the simulation parameters

  • output – (string) this is the name of the output directory to be created

gaussian_broadening(broaden, resolution=1)¶

Performs gaussian broadening on IR spectrum generates attribute self.IR - np.array with dimmension 4000/resolution consisting gaussian-boraden spectrum

Parameters

  • broaden – (float) gaussian broadening in wn-1

  • resolution – (float) resolution of the spectrum (number of points for 1 wn) defaults is 1, needs to be fixed in plotting

load_log(file_path)¶

Creates a conformer object using infromation from a file given the file path

Parameters

file_path – (string) path to file

load_model(file_path)¶

Loads a file and constructs a conformer

Parameters

file_path – (string) this is the directory of the data file being used to condtruct a conformer object

measure_c6()¶

Dihedral angle between carbon 5 and carbon 6. Sugars with 1,6 glycosidic bond does not have c6 atoms. This angle would just the angle on the glycocidic bond

measure_glycosidic()¶

Measures the dihedral angle of the glycosidic bond

measure_ring()¶

Calculates the dihedral angle between rings

plot_ir(xmin=900, xmax=1700, scaling_factor=0.965, plot_exp=False, exp_data=None)¶

Plots the IR spectrum in xmin – xmax range, x-axis is multiplied by scaling factor, everything is normalized to 1. If exp_data is specified, then the top panel is getting plotted too. Need to add output directory. Default name is self._id

plot_ir2(xmin=900, xmax=1700, scaling_factor=0.965, plot_exp=False, exp_data=None, exp_int_split=False, normal_modes=False)¶

Plots the IR spectrum in xmin – xmax range, x-axis is multiplied by scaling factor, everything is normalized to 1. If exp_data is specified, then the top panel is getting plotted too. Need to add output directory. Default name is self._id

rotation_operation(conf_name, conf_index, rotmat)¶

Stores the following in each conformer obj the name of the conformer it is being rotated to match, the index of that conformer and the rotation matrix. The rotation matrix is then multiplied to the existing xyz matrix and the vibrations matrix. Those rotated matrices are also saved.

Parameters

  • conf_name – (string) name of the conformer this conformer has been rotated to

  • conf_index – (int) index of the conformer rotated to, in the list of conformers of the conformer space

  • rotmat – (3x3 numpy array) the rotation matrix

run_gaussian(mpi=False)¶

Opens and runs a simulation in the Gaussian application. To run this function GausView must already be intalled on the device

Parameters

mpi – (bool) message passing interface, set true to use parallel programming. experimental.

set_c6(ring, dih)¶

Sets a new dihedral angle between carbon 5 and carbon 6

Parameters

  • ring – index to indicate which ring is being considered in the molecule

  • dih – the new dihedral angle

set_glycosidic(bond, phi, psi, omega=None, gamma=None)¶

Changes the dihedral angle of the glycosidic bond

Parameters

  • bond – (int) index of which glycosidic bond to alter

  • phi – (float) phi angle

  • psi – (float) psi angle

show_xyz(width=600, height=600)¶

Displays a 3D rendering of the conformer using Py3Dmol

Parameters

  • width – the width of the display window

  • height – the height of the display window

update_topol(models)¶

Updates topology and checks for proton shifts

update_vector()¶

Check if this can be deleted… might not need it

glyP.display_utilities module¶

glyP.display_utilities.display_table(index, molecule_ids, molecule_names, rmsd_all, rmsd_no_H, pendry)¶

Prints into terminal and saves as .txt a table displaying each conformer and the associated value rmsd, rmsd without H and pendry R factor

Parameters

  • index – (int) all the values are calculated comparing all conformers to one conformer which is sepcified by this index

  • molecule_ids – (list) the list of molecule id number

  • molecule_names – (list) the lost of molecule names

  • rmsd_all – (list) list of rmsd values

  • rmsd_no_H – (list) list of rmsd values without H

  • pendry – (list) list of all pendry values

glyP.display_utilities.generate_heatmap(matrix, max_value=0.5)¶

Returns a heatmap of the 2D matrix

Parameters

  • matrix – (list) 2D list

  • max_value – a number for a max cutoff value to be represented in the heatmap

glyP.display_utilities.make_plots(conf_space_object, index=0, bar=True, scatter=True)¶

Displays plots

Parameters

  • conf_space_object – an initialized conformer space, this should be a list of conformer objects containing molecule data

  • index – (int) identifies which conformer in the list of conformers, the default is the first conformer at index 0

  • bar – (bool) specifies if bar plots should be generated, this is a triple bar plot (rmsd, rmsd without H, pendry factor); default set to TRUE

  • scatter – (bool) specifies if scatterplot should be generated, there will be 3 things plotted (rmsd, rmsd without H, pendry factor); default set to TRUE

glyP.display_utilities.return_2d_lists(conf_space_object)¶

Returns 3 different 2D lists calculating rmsd, rmsd without considering H atoms and pendry R factor

Parameters

conf_space_object – an initialized conformer space, this should be a list of conformer objects containing molecule data

Returns

(list) 3 different 2D lists

glyP.ga_operations module¶

glyP.ga_operations.cross_over(conf1, conf2)¶

Swaps angle measures of two conformers

Parameters

  • conf1 – the first conformer object

  • conf2 – the second conformer object

glyP.ga_operations.modify_c6(conf, ring)¶

Modifies the 6th carbon of a ring, randomly draws an integer and edits the dihedral angle

Parameters

  • conf – a conformer object

  • ring – (int) index that specifies which ring of the conformer is being edited

glyP.ga_operations.modify_glyc(conf, bond)¶

Modifies the angle between the two rings attached by a specified glycosidic bond

Parameters

  • conf – a conformer object

  • bond – (int) index of which edge in the list of edges of the conformer

glyP.ga_operations.modify_ring(conf, ring, phi, psi)¶

This does nothing at the moment

glyP.rmsd module¶

RMSD calculation, via quaterion-based characteristic polynomial in pure python/numpy. Reference ——— Rapid calculation of RMSDs using a quaternion-based characteristic polynomial. Acta Crystallogr A 61(4):478-480.

glyP.rmsd.rmsd_qcp(conformation1, conformation2, rotation_matrix=False)¶

Returns the optimal rotation matrix of two conformers and compute the RMSD with Theobald’s quaterion-based characteristic polynomial Rapid calculation of RMSDs using a quaternion-based characteristic polynomial. Acta Crystallogr A 61(4):478-480. This function is taken from Liu, Pu, Dimitris K. Agrafiotis, and Douglas L. Theobald. “Fast determination of the optimal rotational matrix for macromolecular superpositions.” Journal of computational chemistry 31.7 (2010): 1561-1563. Things to revise: -The function is copy and paste the determination of max_eigenvalue from the rmsd function -returning the identity matrix if all columns of the adj matrix is too small should be dependent on the size of the conformers in question. Rn it is just hardcoded from the original script. This does not impact this function very much because the case is very unlikely and it returns an identity matrix as an indication of failure.

Parameters

  • conformation1 – (np.ndarray, shape=(n_atoms, 3)) The cartesian coordinates of the first conformation

  • conformation2 – (np.ndarray, shape=(n_atoms, 3)) The cartesian coordinates of the second conformation

  • rotation_matrix – (bool) parameter that will only return the rotation matrix when set to true. False is the default for the function so it will return the rmsd

Returns

(list) This is a list of floats that indicate the optimal rotation matrix of two conformers. The optimal rotation matrix is the rotation that minimizes rmsd of the two conformers

glyP.rmsd.test()¶

This function was just to test the rmsd function. Ignore this. This should just be removed

glyP.utilities module¶

glyP.utilities.adjacent_atoms(conn_mat, at)¶

returns all adjacent atoms to a specific atom in a conformation

Parameters

  • conn_mat – the connectivity matrix

  • at – a selected atom

Returns

all adjacent atoms to the selected atom

glyP.utilities.calculate_normal_vector(conf, list_of_atoms)¶

Calculate the normal vector of a plane by cross product of two vectors belonging to it.

Parameters

  • list_of_atoms – (list) of 3 atoms

  • conf – a conformer object

Return cross_product

cross product of two matricies

glyP.utilities.calculate_ring(xyz, ring_atoms)¶

Calculates the dihedral angle between rings

Parameters

  • xyz – (list) a list of positions

  • ring_atoms – (list) list of atoms in a ring of the selected conformer

glyP.utilities.calculate_rmsd(conf1, conf2, atoms=None)¶

calculate the rmsd of two conformers; how similar the positions of the atoms are to each other

Parameters

  • conf1 – a conformer object

  • conf2 – another conformer object

Atoms

(string) passing the atomic symbol the function will omit those atoms when calculating the rmsd. Most commonly used is ‘H’ to remove hydrogen

glyP.utilities.clashcheck(conf, cutoff=1.0)¶

Checks if there is a clash between atoms

Parameters

  • conf – passes a conformer object

  • cutoff – (float) the maximum value that would not be considered a clashing distance, default to 1.0

Returns

(bool) True for a clash or False for no clash

glyP.utilities.deriv(spec, h)¶

calculate first derivative of function ‘spec’ using the central finite difference method up to 6th order, and for the first 3 and last 3 grid points the forward/backward finite difference method up to 2nd order. …as used in f77-program and suggested by Zanazzi-Jona…

Parameters

  • spec – (list) an IR spectrum

  • h – (float) the delta x between each data point, must be less than 1 for accurate integral results

Returns

the first derivative of the parameter spec

glyP.utilities.determine_carried_atoms(at1, at2, conn_mat)¶

Find all atoms necessary to be carried over during rotation of an atom 2

Parameters

  • at1 – (list) the xyz coordinates of an atom

  • at2 – (list) the xyz coordinates of another atom

  • conn_matt – the connectivity matrix of a conformer

glyP.utilities.draw_random()¶

draw a random float between 0 and 1

Returns

(float) random sample

glyP.utilities.draw_random_int(top=1)¶

draw a random int between 0-top

Parameters

top – (int) the upperbound of the random int generator

Returns

(int) returns a random integer

glyP.utilities.dtime()¶

finds the current date and time :return: the current date and time

glyP.utilities.element_symbol(A)¶

A dictionary for atomic number and atomic symbol

Parameters

A – either atomic number or atomic symbol for Hydrogen, Carbon, Nitrogen, Oxygen, Fluorine and Silicon

Returns

the corresponding atomic symbol or atomic number

glyP.utilities.error(msg)¶

write error message and quit

Parameters

msg – (string) the message to be outputted

glyP.utilities.get_distance(at1, at2)¶

Finds the distance between two atoms

Parameters

  • at1 – (list) a list of xyz coordinates of one atom

  • at2 – (list) a list of xyz coordinates of another atom

Returns

(float) the distance between 2 atoms

glyP.utilities.get_range(tspec, espec, w_incr, shift, start, stop)¶

determine wavenumber range within the comparison between theoretical and experimental spectrum is performed (depends on the shift)

Parameters

  • tspec – (list) theoretical spectrum

  • espec – (list) experimental spectrum

  • w_incr – (float) grid interval of the spectra – should be 1 or smaller!

  • shift – the shift on the spectrum

  • start – (int) the starting point on the spectrum

  • stop – (int) the ending point on the spectrum

Returns

(tnstart, tnstop, enstart, enstop) the start and stop for thee range of the theoretical and experimental spectra

glyP.utilities.integrate(integrand, delta)¶

integrate using the trapezoid method as Zanazzi-Jona suggested and was used in the f77-program…

Parameters

  • integrand – (list) A spectrum that is to be integrated

  • delta – (float) the delta x in the trapezoidal method, the length of the base of each trapezoid. In implementation it is the increment of the data point of the spectrum, must be less than 1 for accurate integral results

Returns

(float) returns a product of the calculated integral and the delta

glyP.utilities.measure_angle(conf, list_of_atoms)¶

Calculate an angle between three atoms: angle = acos(dot(X,Y)/(norm(X)*norm(Y)))

Parameters

  • list_of_atoms – (list) list of 3 atoms

  • conf – a conformer object

glyP.utilities.measure_dihedral(conf, list_of_atoms)¶

Calculate a dihedral angle between two planes defined by a list of four atoms. It returns the angle and the rotation axis required to set a new dihedral.

Parameters

list_of_atoms – (list) list of 4 atoms

glyP.utilities.rfac(espec, tspec, start=1000, stop=1800, w_incr=1.0, shift_min=- 10, shift_max=10, shift_incr=1, r='pendry', VI=10)¶
%prog [options] r-fac.in

Reads two spectra and calculates various R-factors – FS 2011 Attention: both spectra have to be given on the same, equidistant grid! NOTE: in the f77-program R1 is scaled by 0.75 and R2 is scaled by 0.5; this is not done here Please provide a file r-fac.in with the following specifications (without the comment lines!!!) (the numbers are just examples, choose them according to your particular case)

Parameters

  • espec – (list) the experimental spectrum

  • tspec – (list) the theoretical spectrum, the conformer spectrum that the experimental spectrum is being compared to

  • start – (int) where to start the comparison, default to 1000

  • stop – (int) where to stop the comparison, default to 1800

  • w_incr – (float) grid interval of the spectra – should be 1 or smaller! (otherwise integrations/derivatives are not accurate) Default to 0.5

  • shift_min – (int) minimal shift of the theoretical spectrum, default to -10

  • shift_max – (int) maximal shift of the experimental spectrum, default to +10

  • shift_incr – (int) shift interval, default to 1

  • r – (string) specify which r-factor should be calculated options: pendry, ZJ, R1, R2 (give a list of the requested r-factors separated by comma). The default is “pendry”

  • VI – (int) approximate half-width of the peaks (needed for pendry r-factor). Default to 10

glyP.utilities.set_angle(conf, list_of_atoms, new_ang)¶

Set a new angle between three atoms

Parameters

  • list_of_atoms – (list) list of three atoms

  • new_ang – value of dihedral angle (in degrees) to be set

Returns

xyz modified numpy array with new atoms positions

glyP.utilities.set_dihedral(conf, list_of_atoms, new_dih)¶

Set a new dihedral angle between two planes defined by atoms first and last three atoms of the supplied list.

Parameters

  • list_of_atoms – (list) list of four atoms

  • new_dih – (float) value of dihedral angle (in degrees) to be set

Returns

xyz modified numpy array with new atoms positions

glyP.utilities.ypendry(spec, d1_spec, VI)¶
calculate the Pendry Y-function: y= l^-1/(l^-2+VI^2) with l=I’/I (logarithmic derivative),

J.B. Pendry, J. Phys. C: Solid St. Phys. 13 (1980) 937-44

Parameters

  • spec – (list) a conformer IR spectrum

  • d1_spec – (list) the first derivative of the IR spectrum

  • VI – (int) approximate half-width of the peaks

Returns

(2D list) returns the calculated pendry y-function
